title: [K-12] Technology-Enhanced Language Learning Program for Higher-Order Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental language proficiency and experience with digital devices
context.additional_context: Activity design optimized for smartphone-centric learning environments, integrating offline sessions with mobile applications

learning_goals: Learners can interpret the logical structure and context of texts through linguistic analysis in technology-enhanced environments
Learners collaborate with 2 peers using digital tools (Google Docs, Padlet) to generate ≥3 critical questions on a given topic and write a 500-character summary report based on discussions.

Learners complete 3 project-based tasks (role-play, poster design, storyboard creation) within a week, applying ≥2 creative problem-solving strategies (brainstorming, analogy) per task, and achieve ≥B (70–80%) in ≥4/5 teacher rubric criteria.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
